Articles.Content: Do you ever want a control system, but RCS is just to darn inefficient? I noticed that Ionic drives have similar thrusts to RCS ports (only off by 1 thrust unit!) and it is much more practical, but there is no way to use an ion drive for control. (Other than using action groups, but ain't nobody got time for that.) So I was wondering if someone would want to add this Idea to their existing Mod?

You might try AmpYear Power Manager Ion RCS [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108591-0-90-AmpYear-Power-Manager-Ion-RCS-v0-12-Forked-from-SodiumEyes](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108591-0-90-AmpYear-Power-Manager-Ion-RCS-v0-12-Forked-from-SodiumEyes)

Awesome, like the electric-thermal Arcjets and Resistojets!

Its a cool idea, but knowing how weak ion thrust is in RL... I personally couldn't use it for RCS. Ion drive just could not move a ship, in the instant of time that you want it moved ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) On other hand, I am using this massively overpowered ion stuff as main thrust for orbital survey probes, stuffing in 10 or more in some cases, and saying "egad, so expensive!" (career mode) - so I have no right to complain ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
